body_html: Our Docker images are updated nightly as long as that nightly package builds (for the nightly- images) and per-release (for latest- and XX.XX-), so if your deployment is time-critical and you only want to use stable releases, I'd recommend using your own image until these changes are deployed.
body_text: Our Docker images are updated nightly as long as that nightly package builds (for the nightly- images) and per-release (for latest- and XX.XX-), so if your deployment is time-critical and you only want to use stable releases, I'd recommend using your own image until these changes are deployed.
body: Our Docker images are updated nightly as long as that nightly package builds (for the `nightly-` images) and per-release (for `latest-` and `XX.XX-`), so if your deployment is time-critical and you only want to use stable releases, I'd recommend using your own image until these changes are deployed.
